page.title: 14DALRY(KIRK) SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: Dalry is a caring community and neighbours help each other as a matter of course.Meals in an emergency and offers of help with transport are willingly given. The Community Council is very active in local interests such as the maintainence and renewal of the many seats around the town. The Citizens Advice Bureau has a 'village link' to help with individual problems Home Helps are organised by the District Council Social Work Dept. to help the elderly and infirm in the running of their homes. 'Meals on Wheels' are supplied The Red Cross Welfare Department meet the need for specialised nursing equipment such as wheelchairs.
